titleStmt.title: A. Heinkle to James F. Robinson
CWG7707

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Military Appointments, 1862-1863

body.p:
Head Quarters
Covington K.Y. Sepr 26th 1862
To James. F. Robinson
Governor of the State of Kentucky
Louisville KY
Respected Sir
Capt Palmer is a Loyal Citizen of Covington, KY: has served in my Regt, & I take pleasure in the endorsement of his petition herewith Enclosed, & in recommending it to your favorable consideration

With highest regards I am
Your Obet Servt,
A Shinkle
Col. 41st Ky Reg
I take pleasure in endorsing the above
